page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The section we are investigating is mainly countryside.Within the stipulated area there is a factory which makes nuts and bolts,but the area is mainly residential in character.Contained within our boundary is a cemetery,which borders on a local amenity area.Also within our area of study can be found,farmland of two types:_ 1.Intensively managed grassland. 2.Enclosed rough grazing. Unenclosed moorland makes up the larger part of the land in this section of Horwich,but there is to be found odd patches of woodland and uncultivated non-woodland vegetation. On the high ground there is a working quarry and there are worked-out mines attributed to coal and lead-mining of the nineteenth century.There are also two reservoirs.
